painPoints.description: No process for users to update their own data easily.
supportingQuotes: We really don't have a process for enabling people to update their data.
Being able to add features that would allow users with proper authentication to update their own information.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: High severity, frequently mentioned by multiple users.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Some users manually update their information on the app, but it's not obvious how.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Frustrates users who need to keep their information current, leading to outdated data.

painPoints.description: Website feels outdated and not contemporary.
supportingQuotes: I just think that we as a club need to present ourselves as being fresher and more contemporary.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users try to adapt but feel the need for a redesign.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Users feel embarrassed and disconnected from a modern community.

supportingQuotes: I feel very, very lucky when I find that button to join.
It's pretty well hidden beneath layers of information.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by a single user but with strong feelings.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users go through the process multiple times to familiarize themselves.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Creates confusion and frustration, especially for new members.

supportingQuotes: I do find the calendaring part clunky.
It just takes a bit more time, I think, to manage the calendar.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by multiple users.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users adapt by trying to memorize their positions in the calendar.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Increases the time and effort needed to manage event participation.

painPoints.description: Limited control over the application compared to the website.
supportingQuotes: We have almost no control over the application.
The application is really, really canned.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by a key stakeholder.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users rely mostly on the website for customization.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Limits users' ability to tailor their experience, leading to dissatisfaction.

painPoints.description: Difficulty getting into popular events or groups.
supportingQuotes: Newbies have priority, so always... get on the wait list.
I know all those ladies. And I'm like, hey, I'm on the wait list.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by multiple users.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users sign up for waitlists or try to form their own groups.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Frustrates users who want to participate but find spaces filled.

painPoints.description: Lack of evening and weekend events for working members.
supportingQuotes: I wish... there were more events like during... the evening.
I can't ever go because it's always during the week.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by multiple users.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users look for informal gatherings or suggest scheduling changes.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Excludes working members from participating in community events.

painPoints.description: Confusion regarding notifications and event information.
supportingQuotes: I've never got an email that says four new things.
There should be full information about it, not just here's a thing that's coming.
painPoints.frequencySeverity: Moderate severity, mentioned by multiple users.
painPoints.currentWorkarounds: Users check the app manually for updates and details.
painPoints.impactOnUser: Leads to missed opportunities and confusion about events.
